summary: Sound Settings Modification for Alert Notifications

content.text:
Why don't scientists trust atoms?

Because they make up everything!

     sleep 0.2 && afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Hero.aiff",

       10 +              "timeout": 8000
       11              },
       12              {
       13                "type": "command", 


The sound right now is not doing so well because it is playing in a way that overlapping with the text to speech. So they should not wait for such a long delay. they should play successively with quick pace and then move on to doing the text to speech.

content.text: I see the issue. The notification sound sequence is taking too long and overlapping with the TTS. Let me fix this by reducing the delays between sounds and the overall timeout.

input.old_string:
"command": "afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Glass.aiff && sleep 0.2 && afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Hero.aiff && sleep 0.2 && afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Glass.aiff && sleep 0.2 && afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Hero.aiff",
            "timeout": 8000
input.new_string:
"command": "afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Glass.aiff && sleep 0.05 && afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Hero.aiff && sleep 0.05 && afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Glass.aiff && sleep 0.05 && afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Hero.aiff",
            "timeout": 3000

content.text: Fixed! I reduced the sleep delays from 0.2 seconds to 0.05 seconds between each sound, and lowered the timeout from 8000ms to 3000ms. This will make the notification sounds play quickly in succession and finish faster, preventing overlap with the TTS.
